title: What is the UEFA Nations League, when does it start and how will it work?
text:
NEW FORMAT What is the UEFA Nations League, when does it start and how will it work? 
The Home Nations will all be taking part in a new format based on international seedings - here is what we know By DUNCAN WRIGHT Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ENGLAND and Wales lead the Home Nations teams who will be taking part in the new UEFA Nations League that begins next year. 
All the countries across Europe will take part in the new format which is intended to revolutionise international football. PA:Press Association England will be taking part in the new UEFA Nations League format 
SunSport gives you the lowdown on the new tournament and answer all your questions. What is the UEFA Nations League? 
National sides across Europe will compete in the new league format that will culminate in a Final Four showpiece event in 2019 for the title of Nations League champion. 
The aim is to improve the quality of international football and reduce the number of meaningless friendlies as UEFA bid to re-ignite interest in the international game. 
They believe more matches across Europe will be more competitive, leading to more interest from supporters who have become bored with international friendlies. How will the UEFA Nations League work? 
Organisers will use the UEFA ranking system to determine the make-up of four leagues (A,B,C and D) from the 55 teams involved. 
Their ranking as of November 2017, at the end of the qualifying campaign for the 2018 World Cup, will be used to split the nations into their respective leagues. 
Each league will then be split again into smaller groups of three or four teams who will play each other – with four teams promoted and four teams relegated in each cycle (every two years). PA:Press Association Wales will be ranked well in the new UEFA Nations League based on their current ranking 
The winners of the four groups in League A will qualify for the Final Four competition. When will the Nations League be played? 
The competition will take place over six matchdays – double-headers during the international breaks already on the football calendar in September, October and November 2018. 
How teams perform in the Nations League will be used to determine which pots they will be placed in for future European qualifiers for the Euros and the World Cup. Uefa The format for the UEFA Nations League What is the Final Four? 
The Final Four will be a showpiece summer event to climax the Nations League. 
The winners of the four groups in League A will play each other in a one-leg semi-final in June 2019, with the winners going forward to contest the final. 
The winner of the final will be crowned Nations League champions.
